messages: 87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:36): hi all
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:38): i have a share and there are few users have permission to access the sare. the username/password is known to public
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:38): is it possible to restrict access to the share from particular machines using mac ids
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:39): is this possible?
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:39): can someone help
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:39): or is there an alternate way to achieve this ?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:47): vishy: you can allow/deny by hostanme/ip address, but this isn't all that hard to spoof
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:48): ||cw: yes, is there a way to control the access using ethernet address ?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:48): smb/netbios doens't not use MAC address at all
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:49): oh
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:49): though, mac addresses are actualy easier to spoof than ip addresses
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:49): oh
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:51): this means, using allow/deny by hostanme/ip address is a better choice
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:51): there are many network cards that allow their mac address to be user-set by the driver
87ade782c74f52be02b2791dcbfe3a6b (19:51): yes
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:51): winbind doesn't pull all yours from all groups, anyone have any idea whats wrong?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:51): s/yours/users
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:52): phlite_: it pulls all domain users and groups
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:52): ||cw: i have users missing from groups
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:52): local users and groups are not technicaly allowed to transfer
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:53): ||cw: for instance, the "Domain Users" has one user, instead of 400
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:53): phlite_: it's possiblt that your winbind cahce file is currupt
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:53): ||cw: can i delete, rebuild?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:53): stop winbindd and delete winbind_cache.tbd
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:53): what does the error "make_connection: refusing to connect with no session setup" mean ?
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:53): (samba 3.0.22 / ubuntu) - client is a program onthe xbox .. it can talk with windows shares however.
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:53): this user has the same problem but no reply : http://lists.samba.org/archive/samba/2005-February/099863.html
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:54): ||cw: ever see sometthing like this?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:54): exobuzz: do you have guest access enlabed?
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:54): yes
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:54): i have "public = yes"
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:54): phlite_: not personaly
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:54): i can connect to the share anonymously from smbclient.
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:54): exobuzz: map to guest = bad user ?
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:54): but it fails to work with this xbox client. but this xbox client works with windows.
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:55): ||cw: the share does work. just not from this specific client.
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:56): ||cw: winbindd_cache.tdb
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:57): exobuzz: you are using MAMEox as well?
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (19:57): yes
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (19:58): ||cw: in /var/log/samba/winbindd.log i don't c it repolling the groups
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (19:59): phlite_: wbinfo -t still work?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:00): [root@city-filer samba]# getent group | grep 'Domain User'
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:00): COF+Domain Users:x:16777223:COF+gisguest
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:00): exobuzz: could be that the mameox client is doing soemthing wrong and windows is just ignoring it, or using magic to fix it
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:00): exobuzz: or an unhandled expection exploit that hasn't ben found to be harmfull

a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (20:00): ||cw: quite possible. there is another xbox application which has the same issue (Maybe similar code base for networking). however, it would be nice to have a workaround for this
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (20:01): if I could tell samba for that share "not to care" about some discrepancies etc
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:01): would have to know what the discrepancy is first
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (20:01): ||cw: the other guy posted some debug information..
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:01): probaly require some network sniffing and some help from #samba-technical
a05d89284df61e7c398e3e87dc3aacff (20:02): ||cw: ok.. i should ask in there then about debugging help ?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:02): exobuzz: might have to, on the surface this seems to go furthure than some common setting
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:02): ||cw: is it possible ther is a timeout issue with winbind grabbing the users/groups? can i increase timeout?

869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:03): phlite_: if you have a lot of users and group, yes, and no.  there is a setting to disable a full lookup, which speeds things up.  I don't recall the drawbacks.  check the list of winbind settings for smb.conf
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:04): ||cw: i see this in the winbindd.log , [2006/08/07 14:13:02, 1] nsswitch/winbindd_group.c:winbindd_getgroups(1032)
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:04): user 'openfiler' does not exist
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:05): ||cw: is it trying to pull with that account?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:05): ||cw: cuz we aint got that account heh
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:05): ||cw: also have: [2006/08/07 14:12:29, 1] nsswitch/winbindd_group.c:winbindd_getgroups(1032)
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:05): user 'root' does not exist
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:05): it should use the machine account
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:07): ||cw: what machine account are you referring to?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:09): ||cw: is it possible problem lies in the fact that i joined with just a domain admin account? do i need the enterprise admin? or?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:14): joining a domain creates a machine trust account.  this is what wbinfo -t tests
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:15): is your domain nt4 or AD?  did you use kinit are you using hybrid mode?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:16): ||cw: i don't understand what this means: [2006/08/10 08:09:03, 1] nsswitch/winbindd_group.c:winbindd_getgroups(1032)
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:16): user 'openfiler' does not exis
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:16): is openfiler the machine name?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:17): i don't know either
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:17): ||cw: openfiler is the NAS solution im using
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:17): ||cw: www.openfiler.com
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:18): ||cw: are these ranges for uid/gid whatever u wanna do?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:18): thats what i have
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:19): that seems exceptionaly large
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:19): mine like 10000-30000 or something
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:21): ||cw: so basically any change i make, what do i do to do a "re-sync" with winbind?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:21): UID can be as small as 16-bit int, depending on how the system was configured
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:21): ||cw: delete the tdb and restart?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:21): changing UID mapping is not trivial
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:22): ||cw: what do you mean adjusting the range is not trivial?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:22): ||cw: also, what do i do to ensure that after trying new things that I am starting fresh with winbindd?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:22): you'd need to rebuild the idmap tdb, as well as change the ownership on all files
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:23): ||cw: how do you rebuild the idmap tdb?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:23): I guess delete the file and let it make a new one
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:23): ||cw: just by restarting?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:24): yeah.  stop-delete-start
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:24): might wanna make backups
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:24): oh this is a test box
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:24): i can trash it
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:24): go for it then
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:34): that didn't help
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:35): ||cw: wanna see the smb.conf or the krb5.conf?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:36): I dont actualy use AD
38753363757be0ef525eb81bee8bbec6 (20:36): Anyone know if some windows apps on XP have problems with oplocks?
41b4180f968f3808a5a5d5717bba6f6e (20:37): ||cw: what u using winbind for then?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:38): nt4 domain
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:38): drfreeze: some database apps do
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:38): drfreeze: especial Acess
38753363757be0ef525eb81bee8bbec6 (20:40): lilo: c-tree or c-trieve one of those apps?
38753363757be0ef525eb81bee8bbec6 (20:40): How about ms sql?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:41): mssql is a server, it can only store database files localy
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:42): any shared-file database that handles locking internaly is likely to have locking issues
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:42): espcialy something DOS based
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:42): it asks for an oplock and doens't even know it (windws defaults)
38753363757be0ef525eb81bee8bbec6 (20:44): We have an app that uses c-tree. I think that has roots as an old dos app
38753363757be0ef525eb81bee8bbec6 (20:45): I turned off oplocks and things seem to be working much better.
38753363757be0ef525eb81bee8bbec6 (20:46): Don't know if there will be a significant speed hit. No complaints so far
